utterance.speaker: 1st EMT
utterance.content: He's got a good pulse.

utterance.speaker: 2nd EMT
utterance.content: Maintain head stabilization and flip him over. My count, guys. Ready. Go.

utterance.speaker: 1st EMT
utterance.content: Sir, we're paramedics. The mailman saw you having a seizure. We had to break down your door. Do you know what your name is?

utterance.speaker: 1st EMT
utterance.content: On my count. One, two, three. Up. We're taking you to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: No, I can't — no. No, I can't…

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Hey, buddy. Buddy, we're trying to help.

utterance.speaker: 1st EMT
utterance.content: Sir!

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Stay out of my house!

utterance.speaker: 1st EMT
utterance.content: You just had a seizure. You could have a stroke. A bleed in your brain.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Leave me alone!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: 35-year-old male — crushing headache and three seizures in the last two days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So it's a bleed, clot, tumor, metabolic, or infection. Stick him in a CT.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can’t.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm assuming he has a giant head.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Severe agoraphobe. The world scares the hell out of him. So we can only test him with whatever we can take to him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fun.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Agoraphobia a symptom?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Only of being shot. He and his girlfriend were mugged seven years ago. That's when it started.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anybody can hate humanity after getting shot. Takes a big man to hate it beforehand.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How'd you get this case if he didn't come to the ER?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I talked to him through his door when he had flu last year. I run the community outreach program now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See? Perfectly reasonable explanation. She's definitely not here trying to work her way back on the team and steal your job or anything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's a legitimate question.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He agreed to meet with us. But even if I can get inside his house, his brain is a black box. We can pick this up in a minute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Take-out menus. But I'm hoping you'll come up with a better answer when everyone asks what we're talking about. Last night —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know this is awkward, but we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's a reason that we've evolved a feeling of awkwardness. It tells us not to talk about things.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I was emotional because of the adoption falling through. And you actually let your human side show for a moment. That is why we kissed. I just want to say thank you for not… taking advantage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're welcome. Any time you want to stop kissing, I'm there for you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Portable equipment can't distinguish a bleed or a tumor. Can't see vasculitis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What did Cuddy want?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I kinda hit that last night, so now she's all on my jock.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Wow! She looks pretty good for someone on roofies.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The only equipment we have is a sonogram and a portable X-ray.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What part of olivine, pyroxene, and amphibole don't you understand?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Pyroxene. Pyro means "fire"…

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: They're indicator minerals. You can't see diamonds so you look for the indicator minerals. I assume the diamond is the tumor or bleed or whatever it is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We provoke a seizure. The indicator is the increased electrical activity focused around the abnormality. We do an EEG, see the focus, see where the problem is, which tells us what the problem is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The Formster and the Camster. Kickin' it old school. Thank God she's not trying to steal your job. Go do it. And search the home for toxins.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I agreed to talk, not let you in.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You could be very sick. We need access.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I'm just not ready.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why does he have two locked doors?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He must use this room as an airlock. Deliveries in. Garbage out. He never has to go outside.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Just tell us when you are. We're not going away.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You want her to admit that all he has to do is ignore us for a few minutes and we'll take off?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: He was shot. Girlfriend killed. He probably has post traumatic stress disorder. He doesn't believe in a just universe. He doesn't trust anyone. Give him some honesty.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I shouldn’t have implied we can wait forever. We've got a whole hospital full of patients. We can give you a few minutes. But eventually, if you don't let us in, we're gonna have to leave.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Just one person comes in.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No. We've got to search the whole house for toxins. How about I examine you in one room and my colleagues will do the search?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm gonna try to provoke a seizure. I need you to look straight ahead, okay?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh, I just, um, I haven't been in a room with anyone for a while. Um, can you just give me a second?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: You're the, uh, uh, person I talked to through the door last year, right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: You were, uh, you were nice… and smart. Kind of made me expect someone older.

utterance.speaker: Cameon
utterance.content: I'm not that young. Must've been scary being shot.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Don't do that. Okay? You — you don't know me. I've got everything I want here. I — I — I make a lot of money writing tech manuals. I get stuff delivered. I work out. I see anything I want over the web. Um, I'm — I'm happy here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You don't seem very happy.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Well, right now I'm not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go away.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Did you speak to Cuddy last night?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's fine. Why would it take anyone more than a few hours to get over misplacing a baby?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You spoke to her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kinda hit that. So she's all on my jock.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wha — what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Huh. Everyone else thought I was kidding.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You hit? Like making out, or full-on sex or —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got a chart laid out with all the bases. I'll take you through it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wh — what are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What can I do? I'm going to ignore her for the rest of my life. This mosquito bite kept me awake.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't care about the bug bite. She's your boss.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So now I have two reasons to ignore her. It was just a kiss.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There's a reason.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. Those large things in her bra.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You were hiding it from me, means it meant something to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I fiendishly concealed it within the phrase "I hit that."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Stop scratching. You'll draw blood.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Finally you said something useful. If I actually break the skin, it'll let the poison out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you… dated Cuddy… there would —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. I get better reception when you're not here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you got?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His place is totally clean. No animals. No hidden drugs or alcohol. No lead in the paint.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And since you're not breathing hard, I assume you're not holding Cameron aloft in triumph. Which means no seizures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, speaking of breathing hard, Cameron, you engaged to Chase yet?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sorry, we should have clarified. We're calling about the patient, not Dr. Cameron’s love life.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We aren't engaged. Moves things along much faster to just give him the answers. Seizures can also be induced through —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: After six years?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: A year and a half. Through sleep deprivation or —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sleep deprivation would take too long. You living together?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We spend most nights together. There's a bunch of drugs that can lower a seizure threshold.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And cloud the diagnosis with side effects. His place or yours?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: His usually.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You would've said interesting no matter what the answer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And no matter what the answer, it would've been interesting. No engagement. Commitment issues. His place, control issues. Not sure whose, but interesting.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, moves much faster this way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where was the patient when he had his first seizure?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: In his entry hallway getting his mail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Getting close to the outdoors, spooked him, raised his BP. Use that fear. Bring him outside.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: He punched out a fireman. We're doctors, not bouncers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. So bring the outside to him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Floors , genuine wood.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why are they here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They overheard me announce the half price bank foreclosure in the ER waiting room. Where's everybody?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cameron’s with the patient. Uh, everybody else went home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because they don't need to be here. Neither do you. And yet you are.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Original? They were here before the house. The shut-in's also original. Come on. Don't be shy.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House, get them out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Easy for you to say. You're not gonna be making some serious capital gains.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This is cruel.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And leaving him undiagnosed is what, altruistic? Procedure worked. He's seizing. What do you see?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Normal theta. Normal delta. This isn't a seizure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's something.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Mr. Nozick, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Stomach's killing me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See? It's something.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Partial small bowel obstruction.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Blockage explains the pain. What explains the blockage plus seizures?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Atrial fibrillation throwing emboli.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Crohn's causing an abscess.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could be a million things. There's no way to know unless we get him in for an MRI on his head or exploratory surgery so we can biopsy his bowels, which he won't let us do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wouldn't. Pain changes things.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He told you to stay out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He can chase me out once he's done doubling up in agony.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever your big problem is, it's caused a complication we call "colon FOS." "Fo," full of. Since we're in mixed company, "S" is stool. Nothing's coming out. So the pain's gonna get worse and worse. We need to stick a pooper scooper in you. We also need to take a look at your bowel.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I made my wishes clear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh-huh, and if the crazy fairy were here, she could grant them.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I'm not insane. I — I feel pain when I go outside. So it — it's rational to avoid that pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Except now you're feeling pain inside.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Not as bad. Nowhere near.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We can give him drugs for the blockage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And if it doesn't work? That blockage will rupture your intestines, spew sewage throughout your body. Whatever you're scared of out there, aren't you more scared of death?

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: You obviously can't stand people. But for me, it's worse. All right? I'd rather die in here than live out there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you don't mind floppy hair and an annoying accent, I know a surgeon who will operate in your home.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: With the risk of infection, Chase won't actually —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not gonna do surgery in some crazy dude's house.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You just said —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What I said was that Chase would put him under at the house, we'd take him to the hospital, open him up, do our thing, then slip him back into his room for the post-op without him ever finding out that we tricked him. Some of that was implied.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's unethical.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He'll be asleep.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He gets to make his own calls even if he's asleep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you siding with him? Oh, yeah, you're that girl who likes broken people because her husband died. And since Chase isn’t all that broken —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Hey, why don't we operate on his infarcted leg while we're at it? Who cares if he said no.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was risking my life to avoid becoming a cripple. He's doing it to avoid sunlight and fresh air.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We've got to make it look good.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I know I'm a pain in the ass. I know it would have been easy just to walk away, but… You're a good person.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Count down from 10.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Let's go!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How you doin'?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Better.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Great. Everything else good?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Uh, everything involving me kissing House is good. Oh, God, you dragged it out of me, you're a genius. It's no big deal. I was feeling vulnerable. He's a friend. And I leaned on him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's funny. I've leaned on friends in the past. Never leaned so far my tongue fell into their mouths.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't think of House that way. I never have.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You know exactly how it would go. It'd start off exciting. We'd get caught up in the novelty and the hostility and the forbiddenness. And then we'd realize that the flirty hostility is just hostility and his inability to open up is no longer exciting, it’s just frustrating. And then it’s the inevitable blowup and the recriminations and we don’t talk for two months…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, it certainly proves you've never thought about House that way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I get your point. I will be more careful with my tongue in the future.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's not my point. Maybe novelty and hostility and forbiddenness doesn't have to end bad.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What time you done? We could try that new sushi place next to my house.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why don't we stay at my house tonight?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We always stay at mine.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's what I mean. We — we used to split it. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't know. Closer to work.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: By five minutes. And my house doesn't look like it was decorated by a drunk rugby player.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Well, we can discuss it. I hadn't really —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why does it have to be a discussion? Can't you just stay over?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You do know they page me when that much surgical equipment is signed out.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He didn't consent.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He consented to the surgery. You think he's gonna sue over where?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He won't even know where. He'll wake up in his house. He won't know a thing about what happened.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Until he catches a post-surgical infection in his dirty apartment and finds out we tricked him and winds up owning the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why aren't you arguing with her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because she's right. I don't care where he gets the post-op, just that he gets it. Keep him here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House. You okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. We don't need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your hand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's weird. I usually don't get the stigmata until Easter.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Please tell Dr. Chase the patient's ready for him now. Stewart, wake up. It's Dr. Cameron. If you can hear me, blink. We were concerned for your safety so we brought you to the hospital. No, it's okay.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Why — why?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's okay.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Why — why?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I just wanted to keep you informed. I didn't want you to have a bad shock while you were recovering from surgery.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Gotta get outta of here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's okay, Stewart. Calm down. Calm down. Stewart. Stewart, I’m gonna sedate you. I'm gonna sedate you.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Calm down. I need some help in here! Damn it! Somebody get in here!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well done. Your patient called his lawyer, threatened to sue us. He's now heading home completely undiagnosed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He'll soon be on his way back. He's sick. He'll crash. He'll lose consciousness. I'll declare an emergency, bring him back in.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not anymore you won’t. His lawyer now holds his health care proxy. The next time we have an emergency, Larry Ruseckas, esquire, will be calling the shots.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I made the right call. If he'd flipped out after major surgery, it would've been worse.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The benefit of being boss is that I don't have to argue. You're all off the case.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Whaaa?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What's going on between you and Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bad lovin' gone bad.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Seriously. Why didn’t you argue with her? She just threw us off the case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because ignoring her is a lot easier. Convince the patient to let us back in again. See if you can clear his blockage with lactulose. If this thing kills him before we can diagnose, it won't be fun anymore.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You gonna keep working on this?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah. I brought in the case.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There is no case. He's gone. You've been tossed. This is totally nuts.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's incredibly sick. We don't know —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Forget about the patient. What is going on with you? This is why we left House's team to avoid this constant flood of pure craziness.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's why I left House. You got fired.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I know I let you down. But you know who else I let down, pretty much everyone who's important to me. My boss, my old boss, my boyfriend. I did that for you. I'm not gonna let you down again.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's like the red badge of idiocy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the confederacy had mosquitoes, we'd all have southern accents and I'd be paying Foreman less.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She kicked you off the case. This is what happens when you don't address it. She acts weird, things get different.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You understand that different implies difference. She's tossed me a million times before.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, she always chastises you. And you'd always come running to me to complain. So you're acting different too. You're scared. You are scared to get involved.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How is that scary? It's rational. Emotionally mature people who work together should not date. Guaranteed breakup. Guaranteed ugliness.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Any relationship that doesn't end in a breakup ends in death. Everything falls apart in the end. That's your worldview. The corollary, which you keep forgetting, is that you have to grab any chance for happiness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why does this matter so much to you? Cuddy and I are fine. The only person getting worked up here is you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't want you to be fine. I want you to be happy. I think if you dated her —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you familiar with the adverb "vicariously?”

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If I wanted to ask her out —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You did ask her out. Last year. Whatever happened there?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't know. I wasn't interested.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wrong. You were interested. But Amber grabbed your genitals first. But now you're single, and that makes you miserable because you think it's too soon for another relationship. So you're gonna make me miserable. Please, get a girlfriend, or a life, or something. For me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better or worse?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Worse. Drugs aren't working. I think we should do the surgery in his house like we planned.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then one of us wasn’t paying attention because I thought that surgery thing was just a trick.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We prepared the room. We hung the drapes. It's probably ten times as sterile as any mobile operating theater you'd find in a battlefield.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We still need Trapper John.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Chase doesn't want anywhere near this surgery. Maybe you could talk to him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can't understand a word he says.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Taub. Doing anything later?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Blood in the field. Not where I'm looking.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: How am I supposed to know where you're looking?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Here's a hint. It's the bloody part.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: The whole thing's bloody. It's a guy with a hole in his body.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's like you've never done this before. Use the suction.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I will. And in fact I’ve never done this before because I went to med school, not nurse school.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, wanna see if your client's actually made of money?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cutting out last piece of bowel.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Suture.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mucosa's pink. Flattened villi.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Intestinal atrophy. It's Whipple's disease.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Explains the seizure and the stomach pain.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Little bleeder here. Cautering.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, wait. The gas —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That always happens during surgery. Just the gas build up in the blockage. Nothing to sue about. Treat him for the burns. Put him on antibiotics for the Whipple’s. He'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's nice of you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He doing good?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uh, burns are healing fine. He's stable otherwise.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Good. So, uh, I could stay at your place tonight if you'd like.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, you're not gonna sleep here, again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You might have noticed the lack of nurses.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because you're not on the case. You can't really use that as an excuse…

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Dr. Cameron!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Wait here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your stomach?

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: My legs are numb. I can't feel them at all.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: New symptom. Peripheral neuropathy. Got worse on antibiotics. It's not Whipple's.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Porphyria.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Liver's fine. Amyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We would've seen it on the intestines.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What did we see on the intestines? Pink mucosa, flattened villi. It's not Whipple’s, it's gotta be celiac. Wheat allergy means she's not absorbing nutrients. Explains the seizures, stomach, and now the nerves.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We should run a blood test for celiac.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not fast enough. Not accurate enough. Force-feed him wheat then do an endoscopy as it hits his duodenum. See if there's an allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His guts just exploded. It might be a tad painful to make him eat.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's House's point. There's nothing diagnostic about it. He's trying to put the patient in pain, force him to come in.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It is a valid test.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So is the blood test, which is painless.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman, listen to that little voice in your head that's coming from the telephone. Force-feed him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don’t. You know House. You know I'm right.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We'll do both tests.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not here to play matchmaker.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House basically… Well, he accused me of being interested in you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, he's just trying to change the subject.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I know. But I do have… I've always… had… some feelings for you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you saying you want to date me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. I — I — it wouldn’t be fair to House and it's too soon after Amber.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: But you thought you should just say it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. I thought you should know.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Let's have dinner tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Or maybe it would be better if we just… had sex.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Pardon me?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: In front of House's office. I mean, I don't want to take any chances. I assume the point of this is to make him jealous and make him realize that he does want a relationship with me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes. You think it'll work?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're an idiot. Trust me. Everybody will be happier if House and I aren't dating.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: You sure this is the best test?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No. But you've kind of tied our hands. Soon as this hits your intestines, I'll look at it through an endoscope. Stewart, I know you don't want to talk about this, but… People who get shot often get PTSD. It's nothing to be ashamed of. It's very treatable with drugs and therapy.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: It's not PTSD. My girlfriend was with me when I got shot. She died.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry. But that's what I mean. I lost someone myself. I know it's traumatic.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: No, what — what — what I'm trying to say is that… I was like this before the shooting. Since I was a kid. Everything was hard for me. I — I didn't go out that much. And — and when I did… Panic attacks. Like physical pain. No, it was, like, worse. It was like I was dying. Then I met Angela. She was the only reason that I ever wanted to go out. But then she died.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Blood test will be done soon.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm guessing that's a new technique.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, you remember that idea that Cameron had about trying to torture the patient into admitting himself?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pretty sure it was your idea. You want me to slow down the test?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Everyone's got all these great ideas today. So you're thinking patient won't leave because leaving causes pain, so we gotta make staying more painful. That actually makes sense.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You'll increase his pain, but not enough to make a difference. He's on morphine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's on morphine now. Pretty soon he'll be on less-phine. 'Cause when you restock, you'll actually be giving Cameron IV bags of saline.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And why do you think I’ll be doing this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Same reason you did the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That was because it was an emergency.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. It was because your marriage is falling apart. When you confess adultery, things tend to go bad. When one part of your life does a Titanic, you make a life raft out of whatever's left, which makes your job more significant, which is why you did the surgery, why you pulled an all-nighter, and why you'll do this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's having me sleep on the couch. Just for a few nights. I'm not doing this to save my job. I'm doing this to save his life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. That's what we'll tell everyone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Buzzzzzzz.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you considered that it's not my place you really want to be walking into right now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rick Ocasek would kill me if I — oh, you mean Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, she's a little nuts. But she's beautiful, smart, funny, and most important, she can stand you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. I came here to have you lecture me on Cuddy, not because there's a killer mosquito chasing me around my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, there is no mosquito. This is all about Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, she's bugging me. Poetic.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have you seen this bug?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you seen this bite?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. What I've seen is a suppurating wound that you've scratched and mutilated into a gangrenous state. Delusional parasitosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am not imagining things.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, you're a drug addict. You're always imagining things. You got bitten the night you kissed her. Your itching always gets worse when you think about her. You need to address this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's my boss.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, you're not afraid of authority. You're afraid she actually is right for you. You're afraid to take a chance because it's too big a chance. If it doesn't work with her, then maybe there’s no one out there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am not rationalizing. I'm better off alone. Also, you seen her ass recently?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're not staying here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No. You can go home. Or you're going to Cuddy's, gonna ring her doorbell… And you're gonna ask her out on a date like regular people do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At 3:00 in the morning? When do regular people sleep?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Buh-bye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is he in enough pain to come in yet?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No. Antibody tests back?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Inconclusive.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Then why are you here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I missed you. Endoscopy?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Inconclusive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then do it again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I know it sucks, but I need to test your stomach again.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: It's really hurting.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I know. I'm sorry. Try to get you on your back and have you open your mouth.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I can't…

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's out.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No pulse. Start CPR.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Get the paddles. Get the paddles!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Who are you calling?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pizza. You like anchovies? I'm calling the lawyer. Genuine emergency. He'll okay admission.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's dying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. Hi. Sorry to wake you. Your introvert is having a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House, if we don't restart his heart…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He can survive 15 minutes on oxygen and CPR. We can get him to the hospital in five. Lawyer says yes. Continue CPR.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 2123 Holden Green. Patient with PEA.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I got a pulse. Cancel the ambulance. He's stable enough to stay here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His heart's back to sinus rhythm, but it's bradycardic. Taub's putting in a temporary pacemaker. It'll keep his heart beating for now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, Cameron, how would you like your old job back? I'm asking 'cause it’s the only way I can fire you.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Sorry. In the ER, we like to actually resuscitate dying people, not just let them flop around.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Could be lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We'd have seen it on the abdomen. It has to be a poison.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Organophosphates.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We checked the place over and over. It's completely clean.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: There where rose petals in the front entry.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Unless he's eating a bouquet a day, he couldn't —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How clean?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Very. He probably has a little OCD.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How often do you wash your tub?

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Every couple days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bleach and ammonia?

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know how kids play toy soldiers in the bath? He likes to re-enact the battle of Ypres three times a week with real gas.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Ammonia and bleach makes chlorine gas.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Highly fat soluble. He lost weight after the stomach pain. Explains why his symptoms kept getting worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Put him on parenteral steroids and sodium bicarbonate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Even if you're right, that external pacemaker's gonna fail eventually. And I don't have the skills to put in a permanent one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, maybe the poison hasn’t completely shot his heart. And you won't have to feel guilty for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How am I gonna place the leads in the exact spot on the right ventricle without fluoroscopy? The force?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Taub put in the temporary one.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You can do that playing pin the tail on the donkey. Permanent pacemakers need precision.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So we can use the portable X-ray.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not real time.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Sonogram.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And what happens when I put him into v-tach because the sonogram isn't precise enough?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's dying.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Exactly why I don’t want to be the one to kill him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You knew I'd have to say no. But you came anyway. You just wanted a reason to be angry at me. If there's something wrong between us, then —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You know why we spend nights at my house? Because when we spend them at yours… I could tell you didn't want me there.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why would I keep inviting you over if I didn’t want you there?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You always kicked me out every morning. You never offered me a drawer. You never cleared out your closet for me. I was just a visitor.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How long have you felt like this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: From the start.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know it's hard for you because you lost your husband, but. I can't keep chasing you forever.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I just tried your house. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clubbing. Good or bad?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Bad. Vitals are dropping. The abdominal pain keeps getting worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means we were too late with the treatment. Tell the lawyer he’s off the clock. We're done.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You're giving up?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Call Taub. Tell him to pick up some morphine. There's no need for the patient to be in pain.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He's on morphine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. He's on saline.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I figured you put him on saline so I switched him back to morphine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I love you. When you reach puberty, give me — His abdominal pain. That was on morphine?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yes. Is there something that causes abdominal pain that doesn't respond to morphine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was right. He is being poisoned.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's this density on his hip?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Just bone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Think less boney.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You think he's got lead poisoning?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Explains the constipation, the nerves, the seizures. Hold him down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not gonna feel a thing… Except excruciating pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The mugger used hollow points. They exploded and left fragments. Your doctors missed a couple hiding behind your hipbone. It's no biggie. Except years later, they started to dissolve, and then, biggie, you started to dissolve.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'll start him on chelation. The agoraphobia, could it —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Lead wouldn't have started to disintegrate till years after.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But it could have exacerbated the fear.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I don't need to change.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I know you think that. But your life could be better. You — you — you’d have choices.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's lying.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: About everything. About his life. He doesn't even think he's happy here. He's miserable.

utterance.speaker: Stewart
utterance.content: I've got everything I need.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah? Well, then why did Taub find rose petals in your entry hallway? Struck me as a little weird. Thought it might be medically relevant. But it actually just told me that you were pathetic. The day you crashed in your entryway… Was your girlfriend’s birthday. You weren't there for the mail. You were trying to go lay flowers on her grave.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, he's got PTSD. Yeah, he's agoraphobic. He's also a coward. You want to change your life, do something. Don't believe your own rationalizations. Don't lock yourself up and pretend you're happy.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You were right. About my husband. It affected me. It still affects me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you're saying you'll never be able to —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I cleaned out a drawer for you. Like a big one.
